DataElement.preferredName: Self-Report Two Week Diabetes Mellitus Medication Use Text Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: indication of Y (Yes), N (No), or U (Unknown) to signify self.-reported use of medication(s) for diabetes or 'high blood sugar' in the past two weeks.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Self-Report Two Week Diabetes Mellitus Medication Use
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Self-reported use of medication(s) for diabetes or 'high blood sugar' during the past two weeks.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Patient Self-Report Two Week Diabetes Mellitus Medication
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Subjective reports made by the patient:No value exists.:Any period of seven consecutive days.:(dye-a-BEE-teez) A disease in which the body does not properly control the amount of sugar in the blood. As a result, the level of sugar in the blood is too high. This disease occurs when the body does not produce enough insulin or does not use it properly.:biologically active substance, including those intended for use in diagnosis, treatment, or prevention of disease or other abnormalities, for the relief of suffering, or control or improvement of a physical or mental state; includes biological products.

Concepts.definition: Subjective reports made by a patient.
Any period of seven consecutive days.
A metabolic disorder characterized by abnormally high blood sugar levels due to diminished production of insulin or insulin resistance/desensitization.

A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.

Property.preferredDefinition: Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.

Concepts.definition: A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No or Unknown Text Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An indication of Y (Yes), N (No), or U (Unknown) for a condition or occurrence.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Were any medications in past two weeks for diabetes or high blood sugar?
